Description: The Federal Communications Commission announced plans to fine Total Call Mobile $51,070,322 for apparently enrolling tens of thousands of duplicate and ineligible consumers into the Lifeline program.

The Federal Communications Commission announced that Total Call Mobile would pay $30 million to resolve fraud investigations by the FCC's Enforcement Bureau and the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York into allegations that the company enrolled tens of thousands of duplicate and ineligible consumers into the Lifeline program.

Tthe United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and the Federal Communications Commission Enforcement announced a $30 million settlement of a civil fraud lawsuit against Total Call Mobile LLC for defrauding the Lifeline Program, a federal government subsidy program that offers discounted mobile phone services to eligible low-income consumers.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York
